captions.text:
Hi guys I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen I want to share with

you, an American classic, egg salad. Now,
this was actually really highly requested

by a lot of you so I figured I'd bring it
to you. This might not have been a dish I

grew up eating when I was a kid because I
grew up in Italy for a portion of my childhood

but this is a dish I do love and I've come
accustomed to and it is one of my husbands

favorite childhood dishes because he used
to eat these a lot for lunches, so I figured

I'd share it with you. It's very easy to make,
you start off with some fresh eggs. I've got

some eggs here, these are uncooked, then I
also have some good quality mayo, if you don't

make yourself, get the best you can afford,
it makes a difference. I also have Dijon mustard,

chopped chives, granulated garlic, a tiny
tiny squeeze of lemon, salt and pepper. That

it all you need. It's very easy. We're going
to get going on making the eggs, hard boiling

our eggs. And, this is how I do it, it's very
easy. I have a saucepan here filled with cold

water. I haven't turned on my burner yet.
I'm going to put in my eggs and then what

I'm going to do is I'm going to turn this
on, bring it up to a boil, let it boil for

one minute and then turn it off, put the lid
on, let them sit in there for ten minutes,

that's all I'm going to do. In the meantime
I'm going to mix together my ingredients here.

I'm going to put a lot of black pepper because
I like a good amount of black pepper in there.

Now, you could put some chopped celery in
here if you wanted to, I know this sounds

silly but to me chopped celery belongs in
a classic potato salad, not egg salad so that

is my little bit on that and just a tiny little
squeeze of lemon, about half a teaspoon or

so, maybe a teaspoon, just because I feel
like it needs a little something sharp to

cut that strong, sort of rich flavor from
the mayo and the eggs. Now this granulated

garlic in there might sound strange and odd
to you but I promise you, it makes the biggest

difference and it is just so incredibly divine.
I'm just going to taste this, that is perfect,

that is really perfect, I am happy with that.
I am going to set this aside, wait for my

eggs to come to a boil, turn the heat off,
put the lid on, let them stay in there for

ten minutes and then rinse them under really
cold water until they are all peeled and ready

to go and ready to get chopped. Now you can
see these are prefect, there's no green ring

around the edge, a beautiful golden yolk.
Now, like I did, I just put them in there

in cold water, brought it up to boil, boiled
them for one minute, turned the heat off,

lid on, ten minutes exactly. And, then I just
drained them and you can put them in a big

bowl of ice water or you can just run some
cold water on them until they are completely

cooled. They peel like a dream. I already
started cutting some and putting them into

my bowl with my dressing if you would and
I just kind of cut them into little pieces

like so. You can cut these as big or as small
as you like. Now, traditionally egg salad

sandwiches are made on good old white bread.
My opinion, I really prefer to make my own

white bread you know for sandwiches because
I feel like I want the bread to be really

good quality. If however, I don't have time
to make my own bread, and it happens often

lets be honest, I want to go and get the best
quality bread I can get and this is one of

my favorites. I get this from Wegmans, it's
got a really soft crust, it's not too hard

and crunchy and the inside is just really
lovely, soft, still chewy, still has got great

texture, so that's the bread that I'm using
today. But you know if you can't make you're

own white bread and I do have a great recipe
on www.laurainthekitchen.com, you can always

buy really good quality bread and you're in
business. I'm just going to finish chopping

all these up and putting them into my bowl.
Get everything in there, you can see I leave

mine pretty nice and chunky because I like
texture and you can see, I don't make so much

dressing or sauce or whatever you call it
so that it's gloopy, I just make enough so

that it holds everything together because
I think that's the difference between good

egg salad and bad egg salad, egg, bad egg
salad, when it's just so gloopy and it's so

full of mayo that you can't taste anything
else, I have a little bit of an issue with

that. This to me is perfect, you can see that
the eggs, you can still see the texture of

the eggs, it's not gloopy, it's just holding
it's shape beautifully. Now, ideally you want

to cover this and put this into the fridge
for a minimum of a about a half hour just

to really let those flavors kind of marry
but I'm going to make myself a little sandwich

now because I can and it smells amazing, amazing.
So, I just have one large piece of bread that

I just kind of cut in half because this is
a little bit of a pre-dinner treat, and then

you can put as much or as little as you want.
You don't put anything else on there except

for egg salad, you can put a little but of
lettuce or tomato on there if you want but

I'm just sticking with the good old classic
and I just love it. I love how that there's

so much egg in there that it's poking out,
lets get that out of there so I don't make

a mess. But look at that, look at those big
pieces of eggs.

That is wow. That is so good, so flavorful, non gloopy, absolutely lovely.
If you're looking for a classic egg salad

sandwich recipe by all means I think you have
found it. This is easy, it's simple, requires

a handful of ingredients, that in my opinion,
they are all the right ones. Go to laurainthekitchen.com

to get this recipe, let me know what other
classic you want to see next and I'll see
you next time. Bye bye.

title: Egg Salad Sandwiches Recipe - Laura Vitale - Laura in the Kitchen Episode 752

Hi Laura --- after you put the lid on the eggs, after boiling for one 
minute --- do you take it off the heat/burner?  I do this with pasta but I 
take it off the heat & let it sit for 20 mins. with the lid on in order to 
get them al-dente (sp?), so was just wondering about the eggs.  Thanks so 
much!  Your egg salad looks soooo delicious!!﻿

comments.text:
I love egg salad. The first time I made this recipe I did not have a lemon 
but I had a lime so I used the lime. The second time I used a lemon like 
the recipe calls for. Today I used a lime again and I've got to tell you I 
like the lime better. It's a great recipe either way. By the way we use a 
green chef'n lime or lemon squeezer we bought at Amazon and it is really 
easy and gets every last drop of juice. I recommend it highly. Thanks for 
the great recipe Laura. ﻿

the peeled, whole hard-boiled eggs in a large bowl and then chop them with 
a pastry cutter. They're done when you've got them in pieces that are the 
size you prefer.﻿

l hate celery so would never use it in egg salad...having said that, l will 
use this recipe to make my next curried egg sandwiches...instead of

a 'High Tea'. For those complaining about what Laura cooks...stop watching 
her videos. l, for one, am grateful she gives up her free time for us and 
shares with us all her expertise in cooking. Laura rocks! and l absolutely 
adore when she cooks with her Nonna...big hugs to Nonna back in ltaly!﻿
